pullRequest.body:
* Also add a test file that uses the `simp` lemmas.
* Add/move the `fun_prop` lemmas to the compositional lemmas.

[Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Derivative.20cannot.20simp)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [7456389336](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18874/commits/74563893361b3171849186e2de6aa9675075d338)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

> It turns out that these are not actually the most useful lemmas to tag with `fun_prop` in practice (although doing these doesn't really hurt; I know mainly what you are adding is `simp`. What you actually want are the _compositional_ forms of all of these lemmas. That is: we actually want things like [Differentiable.exp](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/SpecialFunctions/ExpDeriv.html#Differentiable.exp) to be marked with `fun_prop`. While we're here do you mind marking those accordingly?

I've noticed that the number of failures of `fun_prop` actually increases when tracing its output, so I expect it is important not to tag them both for performance reasons.

I applied the `fun_prop` attributes to the compositional forms only, and therefore I removed some `fun_prop` attributes in `Trigonometric.Deriv`.

It turns out that these are not actually the most useful lemmas to tag with `fun_prop` in practice (although doing these doesn't really hurt; I know mainly what you are adding is `simp`. What you actually want are the *compositional* forms of all of these lemmas. That is: we actually want things like [Differentiable.exp](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/SpecialFunctions/ExpDeriv.html#Differentiable.exp) to be marked with `fun_prop`. While we're here do you mind marking those accordingly?

Looks innocuous, and useful enough. Two nits; please address before merging. Thanks!

Can you use the new +option syntax here? Also below?
I had to dig to the actual PR description https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/5883 to figure out that this had shorter syntax.

pullRequest.title: chore: add some simp and fun_prop attributes

### PR summary [7456389336](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18874/commits/74563893361b3171849186e2de6aa9675075d338)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Looks innocuous, and useful enough. Two nits; please address before merging. Thanks!
maintainer delegate
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

It turns out that these are not actually the most useful lemmas to tag with `fun_prop` in practice (although doing these doesn't really hurt; I know mainly what you are adding is `simp`. What you actually want are the *compositional* forms of all of these lemmas. That is: we actually want things like [Differentiable.exp](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/SpecialFunctions/ExpDeriv.html#Differentiable.exp) to be marked with `fun_prop`. While we're here do you mind marking those accordingly?

> It turns out that these are not actually the most useful lemmas to tag with `fun_prop` in practice (although doing these doesn't really hurt; I know mainly what you are adding is `simp`. What you actually want are the _compositional_ forms of all of these lemmas. That is: we actually want things like [Differentiable.exp](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/SpecialFunctions/ExpDeriv.html#Differentiable.exp) to be marked with `fun_prop`. While we're here do you mind marking those accordingly?

I've noticed that the number of failures of `fun_prop` actually increases when tracing its output, so I expect it is important not to tag them both for performance reasons.

I applied the `fun_prop` attributes to the compositional forms only, and therefore I removed some `fun_prop` attributes in `Trigonometric.Deriv`.
